title: Hotfixes: June 20, 2025
summary: This World of Warcraft blog post details numerous hotfixes across various game versions, including The War Within, Cataclysm Classic, and Season of Discovery. Updates address class balance issues, item fixes, quest resolutions, and player versus player adjustments. Notable changes include class ability fixes for Paladins and Shamans, threat generation increases for tanks, and several PvP-specific tuning adjustments for classes like Hunters, Mages, and Warriors. Season of Discovery also received several specific bug fixes and balance adjustments.

Warrior.summary:
Hotfixes for The War Within era have been released:

  • Warrior:
    • Arms: Whirlwind damage increased by 100%. Colossus Smash can no longer be parried.
    • Fury: Whirlwind damage increased by 120%. Thunder Clap damage increased by 25%. Odyn’s Fury damage increased by 30%. Mountain Thane: Thunder Blast damage increased by 25%.
    • Protection: Fixed a bug causing Shield Charge to deal damage extra times or to targets near their starting position.
  • General: Threat generation for all tank specializations increased by 15%.
  • PvP: Arms Execute damage reduced by 15%; Rend damage increased by 15%. Wrecking Throw and Shattering Throw shield damage increases are 75% less effective.

Mage.summary:
Here's a summary of the Mage-related hotfixes from the provided blog post:

  • Frost Mage: All damage dealt by Frost Mages has been increased by 3% (does not affect PvP).
  • Fire Mage (PvP): Pyroblast, Fire Blast, Fireball, and Scorch damage have been increased by 15-20% in PvP combat.
  • Mage PvP Talent: The Overpowered Barrier talent for both Frostfire and Fire Mages now causes Blazing Barrier to reflect 40% of damage absorbed, down from 60%.
  • Mage PvP Talent: Frostfire's Isothermic Core talent now causes Meteor to call down a Comet Storm at 200% effectiveness, reduced from 250%.

Rogue.summary:
The latest hotfixes for World of Warcraft, relevant to The War Within and beyond, include a 5% all damage increase for Subtlety Rogues in non-PvP content (May 27, 2025).

Additionally, PvP-specific changes for Rogues include an increase to Combat Stamina for Outlaw Rogues, boosting Stamina by 18% in PvP combat (May 27, 2025).

Other Rogue-related fixes include an issue preventing Blade Flurry from dealing increased damage to targets with the Fazed debuff, and fixes for Blade Flurry's target count and damage with the Deft Maneuvers talent (April 30, 2025). For Assassination, Kingsbane can no longer be parried (April 30, 2025). Season of Discovery notes mention that the Scarlet Enclave damage Rogue 2-piece set bonus will now behave consistently (May 22, 2025), and Carnage will no longer fall off prematurely with Cutthroat's Garrote (May 16, 2025).

Priest.summary:
Here's a summary of the hotfixes relevant to Priests in Retail WoW:
  • Discipline: Resolved an issue with Power Word: Shield tracking on the Cooldown Manager to correctly show cooldowns instead of duration.
  • Holy: Fixed an issue where Prayer of Healing could be displayed on the Cooldown Manager even when not talented into it.
  • Shadow: Psychic Link now deals 35% of damage to targets afflicted by Vampiric Touch (was 30%). Halo damage increased by 30%. Voidweaver: Entropic Rift damage increased by 12%.
  • PvP (Discipline): Power Word: Radiance healing is no longer reduced by 10% in PvP. Ultimate Penitence damage and healing increased by 35% in PvP.

Paladin.summary:
Recent hotfixes for Paladins in Retail WoW and The War Within include:

  • Templar: Resolved an issue where Divine Hammer and Shield of the Righteous were not casting Empyrean Hammer.
  • Holy: Increased healing for Lightsmith: Blessing of the Forge by 15% and Lightsmith: Hammer and Anvil by 20%.
  • Retribution: Fixed an issue with the interaction between Avenging Wrath and Radiant Glory.
  • Protection: Added support for Sentinel and several PvP talents to the Cooldown Manager.
  • Season of Discovery: The Scarlet Enclave Protection 6-set bonus now correctly allows the use of Avenging Wrath while under the effects of Forbearance.

Hunter.summary:
Recent hotfixes for World of Warcraft include updates relevant to Hunters:

  • Survival Hunter: Explosive Shot and Fury of the Eagle damage have been increased by 15% and 25% respectively.
  • Marksmanship Hunter: An issue preventing Hunters from dying while channeling Rapid Fire from keeping them in combat upon resurrecting has been fixed.
  • Hunter PvP: Master's Call has been adjusted to correctly apply its effects to the Hunter and their pet, regardless of target. Command Pet now retains overridden spells in arenas. Survival Hunter's Raptor Strike and Mongoose Bite no longer fail to deal damage on targets in breakable crowd control, and Flanking Strike correctly fails to cast if the pet is rooted or crowd-controlled. Marksmanship Hunter's Spotter's Marks now correctly obey PvP multipliers.

Warlock.summary:
Warlock hotfixes include:

  • Destruction Warlocks: Specific Diabolist talents such as Ruination, Wicked Cleave, Chaos Salvo, and Felseeker received damage increases. Gloom of Nathreza was adjusted to increase single-target spell damage taken by Havoc targets.
  • Hellcaller Warlocks: Fixed an issue where Vile Taint triggered Blackened Soul more than intended and a bug where Blackened Soul wouldn't stack correctly with rapid Soul Shard spender casts. Wither pandemic refresh issues were also addressed.
  • Demonology Warlocks: Addressed UI issues with Shadow Bolt and Hand of Gul'dan appearing on the cooldown bar without the necessary talents, and glow issues with Hand of Gul'dan and Chaos Bolt when Demonic Art was active.
  • PvP: Demon Skin's armor increase is now 30% more effective in PvP combat.
  • Season of Discovery: The Naxxramas 4-piece damage bonus now correctly applies to Corruption from the Scarlet Enclave tank 2-piece, and the Scarlet Enclave Tank 4-piece heal from Corruption ticks now correctly occurs from the Naxxramas 4-piece instant tick.

Death Knight.summary: Recent hotfixes for The War Within and later have focused on class balance and PvE adjustments. While no direct Death Knight class changes are listed, all tank specializations saw a 15% increase in threat generation to improve their ability to hold aggro. In PvP, Death Knights received several buffs: Improved Death Strike is no longer reduced by 50%, Frost Strike and Obliterate damage were increased by 12%, and Unholy's Magus of the Dead Shadow Bolt damage is no longer reduced by 50%, with Festering Strike damage increased by 100%.

Druid.summary: Druid class hotfixes primarily focus on UI elements for Retail WoW. Guardian Druids now have Bristling Fur and several PvP talents displayed on the Cooldown Manager, with Tooth and Claw added to Tracked Buffs. Maul only appears on the Cooldown Manager if Tooth and Claw or Ravage is known.

Monk.summary: Here are the hotfixes relevant to the Monk class: * Zen Flight no longer restricts casting. * Fixed an issue that caused physical damage modifiers to reduce the healing magical damage transfers through Ancient Teachings. * Fixed an issue that caused Aspect of Harmony to not apply to targets with a healing absorb present. * Fixed an issue that caused Unity Within to not automatically if no enemy targets are present when the channel ends for Windwalker Monks. * (PvP) Fixed an issue that caused Feather Feet to not function with Song of Chi-Ji.

Evoker.summary:
Recent hotfixes for World of Warcraft have introduced several changes impacting Evokers:

  • Augmentation Evoker: The Nerub-ar Palace 2-piece set bonus now increases Upheaval damage by 15% (was 30%) and Eruption damage by 15% per stack (was 30%). Developers noted this set became stronger than intended due to recent buffs to Augmentation's personal damage.
  • Preservation Evoker: Healing for all spells and abilities has been increased by 4% (excluding PvP). Specific healing buffs include Living Flame (+30%), Spiritbloom (+20%), and Echo's base healing (+100%).
  • Augmentation Evoker (Bug Fixes): Addressed an issue where Mass Eruption would not benefit from other effects that increased Eruption's damage. Also fixed an issue where Mass Eruption and Bombardments could trigger from Eruptions cast by Overlord without the Breath of Eons talent.

Demon Hunter.summary:
This blog post details hotfixes for various World of Warcraft content. For Demon Hunters, specific fixes include:

  • May 6, 2025:
    • Demon Hunter (General): Fixed an issue with the Aldrachi Reaver where Art of the Glaive stacks weren't correctly tracked on the Cooldown Manager.
    • Havoc: Resolved a bug preventing A Fire Inside from dynamically updating the damage bonus for Immolation Aura based on Mastery.

Delves.summary:
Here's a summary of the hotfixes relevant to Delves in The War Within and later:

  • Delves:
    • Fixed an issue where the Big Wheel of Cheese would not grant experience to Brann.
    • Fixed an issue where some delve equipment was not requiring player level 80 to be equipped.

Raiding.summary:
The provided blog post details several hotfixes relevant to raiding. Key changes include:

*   **Tank Threat:** A 15% increase to all tank specializations' threat generation to address difficulties in gaining and holding threat.
*   **Liberation of Undermine:**
    *   Giga Bombs on Mythic difficulty now have a 30-second longer lifetime for Chrome King Gallywix.
    *   The minimum player requirement for Fused and Tick-Tock Canisters was reduced to 1 on Normal and Heroic for Chrome King Gallywix.
    *   Several bosses (Stix Bunkjunker, Scrapmaster, Sprocketmonger Lockenstock, One-Armed Bandit) had their health or abilities adjusted on Mythic and Heroic difficulties.
*   **Darkflame Cleft:** An issue where a Shuffling Horror could fall through the world was fixed.
*   **Operation: Mechagon - Workshop:** An issue preventing other D.0.G.s from casting Fiery Jaws when Junkyard D.0.G. was rooted has been addressed.

M+.summary:
This blog post details hotfixes for World of Warcraft, with several entries relevant to M+ content:

  • Classes: Addressed issues with Paladin's Divine Hammer/Shield of the Righteous, Shaman's Static Accumulation and Earth/Water Shield interactions with Therazane's Resilience.
  • Dungeons and Raids: Fixed issues in Darkflame Cleft (Shuffling Horror falling through world, Wild Wallop visual) and Liberation of Undermine (Giga Bombs lifetime increased on Mythic, player count reduced for certain mechanics).
  • Items: Resolved an issue with the D.I.S.C. belt's Cauterizing Bolts not hitting players outside the party.
  • Tank Threat: Increased threat generation for all tank specs by 15%.

PvP.summary:
PvP hotfixes primarily focus on class adjustments:

  • Druid: Balance's Wrath damage increased in PvP.
  • Death Knight: Improved Death Strike no longer reduced in PvP; Frost Strike and Obliterate damage increased in PvP; Unholy's Magus of the Dead Shadow Bolt damage no longer reduced in PvP; Festering Strike damage increased in PvP.
  • Mage: Fire and Frostfire's Barrier reflection reduced; Fire's Pyroblast, Fire Blast, Fireball, Scorch, and Frostfire Bolt damage increased in PvP.
  • Priest: Discipline's Power Word: Radiance healing no longer reduced in PvP; Ultimate Penitence damage and healing increased in PvP.
  • Rogue: Outlaw's Combat Stamina increased in PvP.
  • Shaman: Restoration's Earth Shield healing, Earthliving Weapon healing, Healing Rain healing, Surging Totem healing increased in PvP; Lively Totems now cast a free Chain Heal at higher effectiveness in PvP.
  • Warlock: Demon Skin's armor increase more effective in PvP.
  • Warrior: Arms' Execute damage reduced in PvP; Rend damage increased in PvP.

UI change: Opposing Battleground names hidden until match start.

Open World.summary:
Recent hotfixes for The War Within and later address several gameplay elements:

  • Class balance adjustments for various specializations, including threat generation increases for tanks.
  • Fixes for item equip requirements and combat effects.
  • Improvements to the Lorewalking experience and quest progression on Exile's Reach.
  • Dungeon and raid adjustments, such as boss mechanics and player count requirements.
  • Various bug fixes for mounts, transmogrification, and UI elements.

title: Embrace the Heat During the Midsummer Fire Festival
summary: The Midsummer Fire Festival returns June 21 - July 5, celebrating summer with various activities and rewards. New in 2025, the festival expands to Khaz Algar with new achievements and cosmetic gear. Players can earn Burning Blossoms by completing daily quests, fighting Frost Lord Ahune, and participating in activities like stealing flames from enemy cities and juggling torches. Dancing around ribbon poles grants an experience buff. The event concludes with a special "Fire in the Sky" spectacle.
